definition: falling and rising tone/third tone in modern Mandarin
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds

sentences.english: Yangping and Shang tone's tone sandhi can be considered the same.
sentences.chinese: 阳平和上声的声调变化却几乎一样。

sentences.english: Economists, of course, are not famed in general for forecasting accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 当然经济学家往往在预测精确性上声命不佳。

sentences.english: The sudden sound of footsteps in silence made her blood run cold.
sentences.chinese: 静寂中突然响起的脚上声使她感到毛骨悚然。

definition: falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
fourth tone in Mandarin/falling tone
the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
third tone in Mandarin/falling-rising tone
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
oblique tone/nonlevel tone/uneven tone (the third tone of Classical Chinese)
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
phonetic value of a character
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
second tone in Mandarin/rising tone
dialectal accent
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
